revised_title: Ethyl-Compounds Containing Alkalimetals: Sodium-Ethyl and Its Properties
tldr: The author, J. A. Wanklyn, discovered new ethyl-compounds containing alkalimetals, specifically sodium-ethyl. He found that sodium and zinc-ethyl react, forming crystals containing sodium and zinc. These crystals have unique properties, such as being reduced by heat alone and reacting with other substances like potassium. Wanklyn also proposed a hypothesis about the electrolytic decomposition of organometallic compounds based on the reactions he observed.
